title: Game-Based Science Learning: Analog Game Development Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, learners assume the role of general citizens. Project-based assessment evaluates the ability to develop analog games using scientific concepts.

learning_goals: Learners can create a design document for an analog game themed around scientific concepts (climate change, ecosystems, etc.).
Learners can develop prototypes of low-cost analog educational games for science using materials like paper, cards, etc.
Learners can analyze and improve the educational effectiveness of games through peer assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
